turns.content:
Sure, here are the 50 risks:

| Name of Risk | Explanation of What Can Go Wrong | Recommended Tasks to Lower Risk | Risk Severity (1-10) | Category |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Fire damage from unattended candles | Unattended candles can cause house fires, which can cause severe damage to the home and personal belongings, and pose a significant risk to the occupants of the home | Never leave candles unattended. | 9 | Fire Prevention |
| Water damage from burst pipes | Burst pipes can cause significant water damage to the home's structure and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Insulate pipes, and open cabinet doors during cold spells. | 9 | Plumbing |
| Water damage from roof leaks | Roof leaks can cause water damage to the home's structure, floors, and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain roof and gutters regularly. | 8 | Roofing and Gutters |
| Carbon monoxide poisoning from faulty HVAC | Faulty HVAC systems can cause carbon monoxide leaks, which can be life-threatening for the occupants of the home and require costly repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain HVAC system regularly. | 8 | HVAC |
| Electrical damage from outdated wiring | Outdated wiring can be a fire hazard and cause electrical malfunctions, leading to costly repairs or replacements | Inspect and update electrical systems regularly. | 8 | Electrical |
| Water damage from natural disasters | Natural disasters, such as floods, hurricanes, or tornadoes, can cause significant water damage to the home's structure and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Ensure that the home is properly insured. | 8 |  |
Ok start over, but make each task separated somehow, so that it's easy for me to paste it into Airtable and then separate them.

Sure, here are the 50 risks, each in a separate row:

| Name of Risk | Explanation of What Can Go Wrong | Recommended Tasks to Lower Risk | Risk Severity (1-10) | Category |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Fire damage from unattended candles | Unattended candles can cause house fires, which can cause severe damage to the home and personal belongings, and pose a significant risk to the occupants of the home | Never leave candles unattended. | 9 | Fire Prevention |
| Water damage from burst pipes | Burst pipes can cause significant water damage to the home's structure and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Insulate pipes, and open cabinet doors during cold spells. | 9 | Plumbing |
| Water damage from roof leaks | Roof leaks can cause water damage to the home's structure, floors, and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain roof and gutters regularly. | 8 | Roofing and Gutters |
| Carbon monoxide poisoning from faulty HVAC | Faulty HVAC systems can cause carbon monoxide leaks, which can be life-threatening for the occupants of the home and require costly repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain HVAC system regularly. | 8 | HVAC |
| Electrical damage from outdated wiring | Outdated wiring can be a fire hazard and cause electrical malfunctions, leading to costly repairs or replacements | Inspect and update electrical systems regularly. | 8 | Electrical |
| Water damage from natural disasters | Natural disasters, such as floods, hurricanes, or tornadoes, can cause significant water damage to the home's structure and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Ensure that the home is properly insured. | 8 | Other |
| Water damage from appliance leaks | Leaks from appliances, such as washing machines, dishwashers, or refrigerators, can cause water damage to the home's floors and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain appliances regularly. | 7 | Plumbing |
| Structural damage from foundation issues | Foundation issues can cause significant structural damage to the home's foundation and structure, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain foundation regularly. | 7 | Other |
| Water damage from bathroom leaks | Bathroom leaks can cause water damage to the home's structure and floors, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain bathroom fixtures regularly. | 7 | Plumbing |
| Fire damage from faulty electrical systems | Faulty electrical systems can cause house fires, which can cause severe damage to the home and personal belongings, and pose a significant risk to the occupants of the home | Inspect and update electrical systems regularly. | 7 | Electrical |
| Water damage from HVAC leaks | HVAC leaks can cause water damage to the home's floors and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain HVAC system regularly. | 7 | HVAC |
| Water damage from appliance overflow | Overflows from appliances, such as toilets or sinks, can cause water damage to the home's floors and personal belongings, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain appliances regularly. | 6 | Plumbing |
| Water damage from faulty sump pump | A faulty sump pump can cause water damage to the home's floors and personal belongings during heavy rainfall, leading to expensive repairs or replacements | Inspect and maintain |  |  |

Sure, here are 20 more risks:

* Burst pipes due to freezing temperatures
	+ Water pipes can burst during winter when water freezes inside them, leading to costly water damage
	+ Insulate pipes in unheated areas and keep the house temperature above 55°F (13°C) even when no one is home
	+ Severity: 9
	+ Category: Plumbing
* Mold growth due to water damage
	+ Water damage can lead to mold growth, which can cause health problems and property damage
	+ Address any water leaks or damage as soon as possible, and regularly inspect areas where moisture can accumulate
	+ Severity:

Oops, my apologies. Here's the corrected format for Airtable:

| Name of risk | Explanation of what can go wrong | Which task(s) can be done quarterly or yearly to lower each risk | Risk severity (1-10) | Category |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Burst pipes due to freezing temperatures | Water pipes can burst during winter when water freezes inside them, leading to costly water damage | Insulate pipes in unheated areas and keep the house temperature above 55°F (13°C) even when no one is home | 9 | Plumbing |
| Mold growth due to water damage | Water damage can lead to mold growth, which can cause health problems and property damage | Address any water leaks or damage as soon as possible, and regularly inspect areas where moisture can accumulate | 8 | Other |
| Electrical fires due to faulty wiring | Faulty wiring or electrical appliances can lead to a house fire | Have a licensed electrician inspect the wiring and electrical systems every 5-10 years, and replace faulty appliances | 10 | Electrical |
| Structural damage due to foundation issues | Foundation issues such as settling or shifting can cause structural damage to the house | Regularly inspect the foundation and address any issues promptly, and make sure that the drainage system is working properly | 9 | Other |
| Roof leaks due to poor maintenance | Poor maintenance of the roof can lead to leaks and water damage | Inspect the roof regularly, clean gutters and downspouts, and repair any damage as soon as possible | 8 | Roofing and Gutters |
| Chimney fires due to buildup of creosote | Creosote buildup in the chimney can lead to a chimney fire | Have the chimney cleaned and inspected by a professional every year or more frequently if used frequently | 9 | Fire Prevention |
| Carbon monoxide poisoning due to faulty heating systems | Faulty or improperly installed heating systems can lead to carbon monoxide poisoning | Have the heating system inspected and serviced by a professional annually, and install carbon monoxide detectors | 9 | HVAC |
| Water damage due to old or damaged roofing | Old or damaged roofing can lead to water damage during rain or snow | Inspect the roof regularly, clean gutters and downspouts, and repair any damage as soon as possible | 8 | Roofing and Gutters |
| Pest infestations due to poor maintenance | Poor maintenance of the house can lead to pest infestations, which can cause damage and health problems | Regularly inspect the house and seal any entry points, and address any pest infestations promptly | 7 | Pest Control |
| Structural damage due to termites | Termite infestations can cause structural damage to the house | Regularly inspect the house and address any termite infestations promptly | 9 | Pest Control |
| Water damage due to leaks in plumbing | Leaks in plumbing can cause water damage and mold growth | Inspect plumbing regularly, address any leaks promptly, and maintain proper water pressure | 8 | Plumbing |
| Fires due to unattended cooking | Unattended cooking can lead to a house fire | Never leave cooking unattended and keep flammable objects away from heat sources | 7 | Fire Prevention |
| Electrical shocks due to outdated electrical systems | Outdated electrical systems can cause electrical shocks and fires | Have a licensed electrician inspect and update the electrical system as needed | 8 | Electrical |
| Floods due to natural disasters | Natural disasters such as floods can cause extensive water damage | Have flood insurance and take preventive measures such as elevating the house and creating a flood plan | 10 | Other |
| Water damage due to clogged gutters | Clogged gutters can cause water to overflow and damage the roof, |  |  |  |
